title: Very controversial opinion regarding daygame… #innerconfidencepodcast
caption: false

channel_info.title: Robbie Kramer
channel_info.description:
I'm Robbie Kramer 🎙Host of The Inner Confidence Podcast & Founder of Inner Confidence, Inc.

I lived an exhilarating single life filled with adventures and lessons, and ultimately achieved what I had always aspired to – finding an amazing, feminine, and loving wife. 

I believe my experiences provide a rare balance of wild freedom and committed love, equipping me with the insights to help you navigate the complexities of dating and relationships in today's world. Let me guide you to embrace your desires, improve your social prowess, and ultimately attract the partner who aligns with your highest aspirations.

You won’t find any fluffy, new-age, or cringy stuff here, just tested, proven and actionable advice that yields results.

Apply to join our exclusive Inner Confidence Community of ambitious men who are actively working together to achieve their goals faster   ► https://innerconfidence.com/community

You can email me at robbie@innerconfidence.com with any questions or comments.

transcription: {"text": "I'm going to say something very unpopular in the day game world. Guys are going to click away. I think body language in day game is extremely overrated. OK, I looked at my students on the first day of coaching. Unless they're making dumb mistakes, I just stop looking because I had that mistake when I was starting out there. I'm a tall guy. I'm six three. And I was approaching shorter girls. I was kind of crunching. But once you fix mistakes like that, I really don't think body language is that important. I think there's probably some body language disqualifiers, right? Like if there's a certain way that you hold your hands, you know, if you're doing something that's like really obvious and off-putting, you know, that could just be like an immediate disqualification. But if you kind of look at the hierarchy of things and looks of like the height and style and grooming and everything out of 100 guys, only a very small percentage is going to be making those disqualifying mistakes in their body language. Yeah. And you can usually diagnose a lot of that stuff just in their photos before even meeting them because really bad body language, which is typically really feminine body language, body language that minimizes yourself a lot, like you were saying. And one thing you mentioned about girls having different tastes and preferences as far as looks go. Yeah, they've done.
